Could you add to the documentation what the `std::string`s correspond to? Are they the skeleton node names?

And the transforms, are they local because they're from a node to its parent? Maybe it's good to explicitly say that too.

content.raw:
Some style details:


* `{` should be in a new line
* Variables should be `camelCased` (i.e. `tfQuat`)
content.html:
Some style details:

  • { should be in a new line
  • Variables should be camelCased (i.e. tfQuat)

pullrequest.title: Add support for playing Actor animation

content.html:
It's fine to keep this as is, but I (and many other people) usually recommend returning early to make the code easier to read.

So here you could do

if (!this->ogreEntity->hasSkeleton())
  return;

and 

if (!skel->hasBone(pair.first))
  continue;

pullrequest.title: Add support for playing Actor animation

content.raw:
Do you think we could add a test for the new functions to `src/Mesh_TEST.cc`?

It could be as simple as loading a mesh that has a skeleton, setting the transforms and then checking the transforms. We can add `walk.dae` to `test/media/`, and in the test code we can find it something like this:

~~~
auto filePath = common::joinPaths(std::string(PROJECT_SOURCE_PATH),
        "test", "media", "walk.dae");
~~~
content.html:
Do you think we could add a test for the new functions to src/Mesh_TEST.cc?

It could be as simple as loading a mesh that has a skeleton, setting the transforms and then checking the transforms. We can add walk.dae to test/media/, and in the test code we can find it something like this:

auto filePath = common::joinPaths(std::string(PROJECT_SOURCE_PATH),
        "test", "media", "walk.dae");

pullrequest.title: Add support for playing Actor animation

content.raw: Sure. I will add the test code  `Mesh_TEST.cc`
content.html: Sure. I will add the test code Mesh_TEST.cc

pullrequest.title: Add support for playing Actor animation

content.raw:
I see you've removed support for pressing tab and changing cameras. I think we have 2 options:

1. Remove all code related to supporting more than one engine, which includes everything related to the tab key, multiple cameras, etc.
1. Leave all the code for multiple engines, with the understanding that it will only work for `ogre` for now.

I vote for option 2, because that should make things easier to test once we support multiple engines. But I'll leave it up to you.
content.html:
I see you've removed support for pressing tab and changing cameras. I think we have 2 options:

  1. Remove all code related to supporting more than one engine, which includes everything related to the tab key, multiple cameras, etc.
  2. Leave all the code for multiple engines, with the understanding that it will only work for ogre for now.

I vote for option 2, because that should make things easier to test once we support multiple engines. But I'll leave it up to you.

pullrequest.title: Add support for playing Actor animation

content.raw: I also prefer option 2. Lemme modify the codes accordingly
content.html: I also prefer option 2. Lemme modify the codes accordingly

pullrequest.title: Add support for playing Actor animation

content.raw: Ah good point, thanks. @{557058:ad32c2b0-bebb-403e-b385-c3c1f7aa1d09} , we'll need to target this to `default`, which will eventually become `ign-rendering3`. This means we'll also need to target `ign-gazebo3` (i.e. `default`). The same goes for `ign-gui` and `ign-sensors`. Let's coordinate this on slack.
content.html: Ah good point, thanks. @mingfei sun , we'll need to target this to default, which will eventually become ign-rendering3. This means we'll also need to target ign-gazebo3 (i.e. default). The same goes for ign-gui and ign-sensors. Let's coordinate this on slack.

pullrequest.title: Add support for playing Actor animation

content.raw:
I made a chain of PRs to bump rendering and gazebo to version 3. Will work with @{557058:ad32c2b0-bebb-403e-b385-c3c1f7aa1d09} to retarget this PR.

## ign-rendering

* ~~[Forward porting version 2 to default](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/182/merge-2-default/diff)~~
* ~~[homebrew](https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/pull/804)~~

## ign-sensors

* ~~[Forward porting version 2 to default](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-sensors/pull-requests/87/merge-2-default/diff)~~
* ~~[Depend on ign-rendering3](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-sensors/pull-requests/88/depend-on-ign-rendering3/diff)~~

* ~~[release-tools](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/release-tools/pull-requests/862/sensors3-depend-on-rendering3/diff)~~
* ~~[homebrew](https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/pull/801)~~

## ign-gui

## ign-gazebo

* ~~[Forward porting version 2 to default](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/409/merge-2-default/diff)~~

content.html:
I made a chain of PRs to bump rendering and gazebo to version 3. Will work with @mingfei sun to retarget this PR.

ign-rendering

  • Forward porting version 2 to default
  • homebrew

ign-sensors

  • Forward porting version 2 to default
  • Depend on ign-rendering3
  • gazebodistro
  • release-tools
  • homebrew

ign-gui

  • Forward porting version 2 to default
  • Bump to 3.0.0
  • Depend on ign-rendering3
  • gazebodistro
  • release-tools
  • homebrew

ign-gazebo

  • Forward porting version 2 to default
  • Bump to 3.0.0
  • Depend on version 3

  • release-tools
  • homebrew
